div.p: 1. The current term for the inhabited sublunar world on earth (often particularly that part of it which is populated or at least dominated by the Han/華夏 people) is tiān xià 天下 "All under Heaven". Compare the Greek oikoumenē.
2. Hǎi nèi 海內 refers to what is surrounded by the four seas, i.e. the whole of the land mass of the world.
3. Sì hǎi 四海 "the Four Seas" includes the landmass between these Four Seas. (The names of these Four Seas are not entirely clear. Perhaps the Eastern, Southern, Northern and Western Seas.)
4. Liù hé 六合 refers to everything in all dimensiones east, west, south, north, below, above.
5. Shì 世 sometimes refers to the world as it is now, the world one lives in.
6. Jiǔ zhōu 九州 refers to the nine regions of the world.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
Vocabulaire européen des philosophies. Dictionnaire des intraduisibles

Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung

note.p: Personification in mediaeval German in Notker von Zwiefalten, Memento mori 18.136Ia du vil ubeler mundus, wie betgriugist tu uns sus! See in particular THIEL 1956

p. 448 Augustine, Sermo 31 has the vocative personification: o munde immunde, in te habitare, et non dolere, impossibile est; in te sperare, et non timere, vanum est; in te tua amare, et non periclitari, impossibile est.

entry.def: Shì 世 sometimes refers to the world as it is now, the world one lives in.

sense.def: *this mundane world; the world one lives in, this world; Rousseau: le monde; this world versus the other worlds entered by the immortals
(future) world 來世
BUDDH: worldly (as opposed to the higher realm of religious reality), mundane
in this world; in the world
of this mundane world
world (see 天中)
philosophical: the outside world
other world

entry.def: The Triple-world comprises the three worlds of existence (欲界 'world of desire'; 色界 'world of form'; 無色界 'world of formlessness'); skr. trayo dhātavaHh, tri-dhātu; pali tisso dhātuyo [CA]

sense.def: BUDDH: the Triple-world > comprising the three worlds of existence (欲界 'world of desire'; 色界 'world of form'; 無色界 'world of formlessness'); skr. trayo dhātavaḥ, tri-dhātu; pali tisso dhātuyo
BUDDH: in the Triple-world
Christian Chinese: this nether world (of ours)
BUDDH: world, (this) world 此世界; world-system
world
this mundande world; 18th century French: le monde
BUDDH: the nether world, this mundane world; the secular world
worlds 諸世間
of this nether world, of this mundane world
in this world
in this nether world world

entry.def: Jiǔ zhōu 九州 refers to the nine regions of the world.

sense.def: the nine regions of the world 揚州，梁州，青州，冀州，雍州，豫州，徐州，兗州，荊州
the world of men, le monde
the eight utmost poles (of the universe)> the whole world
everything in all directions, especially including the uncivilised world; far-flung regions

entry.def: Liù hé 六合 refers to everything in all dimensiones east, west, south , north, below, above.

sense.def: inhabited world
this dark world; the darkness of this mundane world
BUDDH: world other than this world; other world; world beyond our's
the whole world, right down to the most distant places

entry.def: Sì hǎi 四海 "the Four Seas" includes the landmass between these Four Seas. (The names of these Four Seas are not entirely clear. Perhaps the Eastern, Southern, Northern and Western Seas.)

sense.def: the Four Seas and what is encircled by them
from the Four Seas and what is encircled by them > from all over the world
the four extremes of the compass-circle: northeast, southeast, southwest and northwest, according to HNZ 3.
the Four Ultimate Points (East, West, North, South)
BUDDH: inmidst dust > the secular world
the earth, the world

entry.def: The current term for the inhabited earth is tiān xià 天下 "All under Heaven", the Greek oikoumenē.

sense.def: 普天之下 all under the sun; the whole sublunar world; the sublunar social world (including the regions beyond Chinese domination) cf. oikoumenē,
in/of the world
worlds 四天下
天下之物 the sublunar world; all there is under Heaven; the sublunar world
In this world; in the world
天下之華夏 all the (civilised, i.e. Han-dominated or Han-accessible) world; the whole (civilised political) world； the Chinese political scene
on earth, in the sublunar world, under the sun
the most V(s) of the Ns in the world
(one of) the most Vs of the Ns in the world
the whole world
the world
BUDDH: ?? on this side > in this world

entry.def: Hǎi nèi 海內 refers to what is surrounded by the four seas, i.e. the whole of the land mass of the world.

sense.def: everything within the four seas
other world; distinct world; different cosmic region
the whole world; everyone in the whole world
BUDDH: the burning room (metaphorical expression for the secular world)

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: all within the Four Seas
the people inside between the Four Seas
[BUDDH] the worlds above and below Heaven
ZHUANG: world of external things and events
nether world 苦海 literally: "sea of bitterness"> this our world of bitterness
the whole world
the world of his one lifetime
the dust of this world
all the lands of the world
all regions of the world
this world of dust
生於天下之間“live in the world" the world as a space (for all things including humans); by implication: everyone in this space
what is contained in the space between heaven and earth
worlds in the universe
world (including the realm of the dead and what is beyond Heaven and Earth)
the whole world
the world on earth below
human world; the realm of mankind
(= 天地之間) the world as a space (for all things including humans); by implication: everyone in this space
